title: Andrew Brown
text:
Andrew Brown is a Senior at UCLA who is planning to graduate in June 2025. He will be graduating with a B.S. in Statistics & Data Science along with a B.A. in Economics. When Andrew isn’t studying, he is working with the UCLA Baseball team as their head manager and analyst.

title: About
text: Hello, thank you for visiting my website. My name is Andrew Brown, I am graduating from the University of California-Los Angeles (UCLA) in June of this year!

title: Hitter Plot Report
text:
AJ Salgado Hitter Plot
Above is a sample report I’ve created from my time with UCLA Baseball.
This report is generally built for single game recaps of each hitter’s performance. The flexible nature of the code allows for the report to be used for cumulative weekends, months, or seasons as well. This is a report from the entirety of the 2024 season.
Through the plot being color coded, you can see where Salgado struggles with pitches or creates hard contact. This is extremely useful for instant feedback and improvement for batters, but can also be used for season-long developmental goals.

title: Pitcher Movement Report
text:
Caedon Kottinger Movement Report
Above is a sample report I’ve created from my time with UCLA Baseball.
This is what is known as a pitcher movement report. Each pitcher in baseball has a unique movement profile, AKA where the ball moves and how it gets there. It is important for analysts, players, and coaches to see how to develop, scout, or attack pitchers based on this report.
Pitch types are color coded for movement and location plot, you may also notice different play results are coded by shape in the location plot.
There is also a small digestible stat table at the top of the page, from here you can get an in-depth view of the pitcher’s arsenal.

title: Pitcher Movement Report
text:
!Pitcher Movement Report: Caedon Kottinger
Above is a sample report I’ve created from my time with UCLA Baseball.
This is what is known as a pitcher movement report. Each pitcher in baseball has a unique movement profile, AKA where the ball moves and how it gets there. It is important for analysts, players, and coaches to see how to develop, scout, or attack pitchers based on this report.
Pitch types are color coded for movement and location plot, you may also notice different play results are coded by shape in the location plot.
There is also a small digestible stat table at the top of the page, from here you can get an in-depth view of the pitcher’s arsenal.
